intro: Gonostegia caudata, commonly known as the trailing geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Gonostegia caudata is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
